column4: can anyone help with a failing install of postgresql , log of install and error is here: http://www.pastebin.org/9189
check log : * The PostgreSQL server failed to start. Please check the log output.
i've attempted to stop ssl, which removes the first line of the error, however the rest remain
so is there anyother app tecking port 5432? as the hint?
not that i can see ... nothing at all\
just make sure please run sudo netstat -anltp|grep :5432 on the server
is any other service working well? (i.e. ftp, ssh etc.?) because the last line says: could not create ANY TCP/IP sockets
ip range stuff doesnt get involve here because as I can see it uses "localhost"
it can run itself without any internet/lan connection
.. somehow u gave me an idea then .. (who knows how my mind works) ... but i have it fixed ...
even if you turn off SSL, it still gives that SSL root.crt error? (I'm thinking that because SSL stuff makes  the socket doesnt work properly (!??) - I dunno what im talking about anyway)
it should be 127.0.0.1, dont use * :) for security reason
a hacker asked a man: "Give me your IP. I will hack you using my tool". The man replied: "127.0.0.1". The hacker says: "Haha you're dead now! I'm formatting your hdd"
